intro: Breynia thyrsiflora, commonly known as the flame tree or red flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that appear in dense clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with three to five lobes, and it often grows as a shrub or small tree. Breynia thyrsiflora is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
